Tables

Usage Guidelines

Tables provide a great way to organize sets of tabular data or other lists of structured information.

Basic table

Adding the base .table class adds the basic table styling, such as headers, padding, alternating row striping, etc.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Border

Add a border to any table by adding the .table-bordered class.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Sortable columns

Add .table-sortable to your table to show that it can be sorted by clicking on one of the column headings.

Your application JS will need to add the class .table-sorted class, along with .table-sorted-ascend or .table-sorted-descend, depending on which direction the table has been sorted.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Hover rows

When an entire row can be selected for an action, add the .table-hover class to the table to highlight rows on hover.

If you want to make a row stay highlighted on click, just use some JavaScript to add the .table-active class to the desired row.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Status indicators

Styling options are available to highlight data to indicate status or draw attention to some needed action.

Row highlights
Project ID Company Status
16460625-4466 Ornare Associates Complete
16150818-7240 Vulputate Posuere PC On plan
16570222-9922 Felis Nulla Tempor Ltd At risk
16600108-0339 Mattis LLP Overdue
Icon indicator
Project ID Company Status
16460625-4466 Ornare Associates Complete
16150818-7240 Vulputate Posuere PC On plan
16570222-9922 Felis Nulla Tempor Ltd At risk
16600108-0339 Mattis LLP Overdue

Responsive table

Wrapping your table with .table-responsive allows the table to scroll sideways when it runs out of space, like on a phone or other small viewport.

Country Capital Population Language Actions
USA Washington D.C. 309 million English
Germany Berlin 81 million German
Sweden Stockholm 9 million Swedish

Mobile layout

When displaying tables on small screens, you can use definition lists to repeat column headings in each cell.

Contact
Hilder, James
Phone Number
+1 718 596 4785
Address
4 St. Pancras Way
New York, NY 10012

Hilder, James

Address
4 St. Pancras Way
New York, NY 10012

Mobile-only pattern

The example above is not responsive. To use it in a responsive application, you will need to have two tables on the page and use the responsive visibility classes to show and hide each as needed.
